tweets.text:
I've seen the stink from Walley's reported from inside Newcastle-under-Lyme @vuecinemas this evening as well as in other town centre locations.

This is exactly what was feared - why on earth weren't the additional requirements of the operator identified earlier? @EnvAgency

Daily dose of poisonous hydrogen sulphide has arrived early in Hartshill-c5 miles from Walleys Landfill-today. Normally get gassed evening/night time. No chance we can go along with government COVID guidance to keep homes ventilated.  #StopTheStink @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids

tweets.text: @DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Is there a long term exposure level of more than 90 days. I would say we are at that point or very close to.

@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids I wonder if they look at the difference between outdoor exposure Vs exposure indoors when it's been trapped in an unventilated house all night? ü§î

#StopTheStink

@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Medium term is 15-90 days and so should already have been applied from 11th March. We are now beyond 90 days of AQM and so presumably long term exposure durations, especially if you take into account increased complaints which began in December and so six months ago!
